page.title: 10WEAVING IN GRAFFHAM
page.content: I saw a weaver who began because she wanted to create something. She taught herself to weave a rug. She has been weaving for 33 years and weaves daily. It takes between 20 & 72 hours t make a rug, and some patterns are very complicated. They are inspired by the country-side. They dye wools with walnuts which make browns and fawns, onion skins which make yellows and oranges, and indigo which make purples and blues. They also use chemical dyes. There are at least 7 large floor looms to weave rugs on and several table looms for smaller pieces. Each large loom costs Â£700 to Â£1000. Evening & day courses are organised when people can weave and dye. You can buy rugs, cushion covers, scarves & lots more. I like the knot rugs which she makes because they are less tiring to work on.
